cold.name: Cold Constitution
cold.description: You tend to feel cold easily and may have lower energy. Your body thrives with warmth and nourishing foods.

foods.proteins: Lamb, beef, chicken, salmon, bone broth

cold.principle: Choose warming, cooked foods over raw and cold items.

heat.name: Heat Constitution
heat.description: You tend to feel warm or overheated. Your body prefers cooling, light foods and benefits from calming practices.
heat.principle: Choose light, fresh, cooling foods and avoid heating spices.

balanced.name: Balanced Constitution
balanced.description: You're in harmony! Your body adjusts well to different foods and environments. Focus on maintaining this balance.

foods.proteins: Variety of proteins: chicken, fish, eggs, legumes, tofu
foods.vegetables: Seasonal vegetables, both cooked and raw, emphasizing variety and color
foods.fruits: Diverse fruits in moderation, preferably seasonal and local
foods.grains: Whole grains: brown rice, quinoa, oats, barley, whole wheat
foods.other: Healthy fats (olive oil, avocado), fermented foods (yogurt, kimchi), nuts and seeds in moderation

balanced.principle: Maintain harmony through variety, seasonal eating, and moderation.

qiDeficiency.name: Qi Deficiency Constitution
qiDeficiency.description: You often feel tired and lack stamina. Your body needs energy-building, easily digestible foods and adequate rest.

teas.name: Astragalus Tea
teas.benefit: Tonifies Qi, boosts immune system, increases energy

teas.name: Red Date Tea
teas.benefit: Nourishes blood and Qi, mild and sweet

foods.other: Dates, honey, walnuts, easily digestible foods

qiDeficiency.principle: Build and preserve Qi through nourishing, easily digestible foods. Prioritize rest and avoid overexertion.

yinDeficiency.name: Yin Deficiency Constitution
yinDeficiency.description: You tend to feel warm, especially at night. You may experience dry mouth, night sweats, or restlessness. Your body benefits from cooling, moistening foods.

teas.name: Goji Berry Tea
teas.benefit: Nourishes Yin, benefits liver and kidneys

foods.other: Coconut water, sesame seeds, foods with high water content

yinDeficiency.principle: Cool and moisten with hydrating foods. Avoid heating, drying, and stimulating items.

phlegmDampness.name: Phlegm-Dampness Constitution
phlegmDampness.description: You may feel heavy or sluggish, especially in humid weather. You might experience excess mucus, bloating, or weight gain. Your body benefits from light, draining foods.

teas.name: Pu-erh Tea
teas.benefit: Cuts through dampness, aids digestion and weight management

teas.name: Hawthorn Tea
teas.benefit: Breaks down food stagnation, reduces phlegm

foods.proteins: White fish, shrimp, chicken breast, beans (adzuki, mung)
foods.grains: Barley, Job's tears (薏米), quinoa, brown rice
foods.vegetables: Leafy greens, celery, radish, turnip, mushrooms, seaweed
foods.other: Lemon, grapefruit, light and fresh foods

phlegmDampness.principle: Eat light, warm, and draining foods. Avoid heavy, rich, sweet, and cold items that create dampness.
